newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: ASM LITHOGRAPHY SEES GOOD 1997 PROSPECTS.
newsitem.headline: ASM LITHOGRAPHY SEES GOOD 1997 PROSPECTS.

text.p: ASM Lithography Holding NV said on Wednesday its market share had grown during the first half of 1997 and it had a positive outlook for the rest of the year.

"ASML's market share is growing as ASML landed new customers during the first half of 1997. We are pleased with our prospects for the year," CEO Willem Maris said in a statement with the company's 1997 half-year results.
The company, which makes equipment for the production of semiconductors, previously said it was uncertain about its growth prospects for 1997 but expected an improvement in 1998.
"After a slow start in 1997, business conditions have solidified and the company is building backlog," Maris said.

"In line with semiconductor market growth expectations, we are seeing in particular the ramp-up of Deep UV photolithography, which is the enabling factor in semiconductor manufacturers' continuing efforts to increase circuit densities, improve functionality and reduce manufacturing cost."
ASM Lithography is 23.9 percent owned by Philips .
